description: Borrowed from French pirouette, see there for more; attested since 1706.

entries.meaning: A whirling or turning on the toes in dancing, primarily in ballet.
The whirling about of a horse.

verbs.description: pirouette (third-person singular simple present pirouettes, present participle pirouetting, simple past and past participle pirouetted)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To perform a pirouette; to whirl on the toes, like a dancer.
